name: @appnest/focus-trap
author: Appnest
description: A lightweight web component to trap focus within a DOM node

scripts.git:add:commit:push: git add . && git commit --no-edit --amend --no-verify && git push
scripts.bump:patch: npm version patch && npm run git:add:commit:push
scripts.bump:minor: npm version minor && npm run git:add:commit:push
scripts.bump:major: npm version major && npm run git:add:commit:push
scripts.publish:patch: npm run test && npm run bump:patch && npm run b:lib && npm run publish
scripts.publish:minor: npm run test && npm run bump:minor && npm run b:lib && npm run publish

readme.text: A focus trap ensures that `tab` and `shift + tab` keys will cycle through the focus trap's tabbable elements but not leave the focus trap. This is great for making [accessible modals](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-practices/examples/dialog-modal/dialog.html).
bullets: Does one things very very well - it traps the focus!
Pierces through the shadow roots when looking for focusable elements.
Works right out of the box (just add it to your markup)
Created using only vanilla js - no dependencies and framework agnostic!
